channel.title: Thoughts on FreeBSD?
channel.description:
What do you guys think about it?
http://www.freebsd.org/

item.title: Thoughts on FreeBSD?
item.dc:creator: @Fire_capez Fire capez
item.description:
@Fire_capez wrote:

It doesn’t seem to like my HDD as it never detects it. I’ve done all sorts of tests and using an older image but it just flat out refuses, i’ve played around with it on a VM and it’s nice a bit behind on the desktop but there are few things I liked about it (the directory for one, jails and the fact it was an entire OS).

Read full topic

item.title: Thoughts on FreeBSD?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

I use OpenBSD for servers. I’d hate to use either on a desktop.

Read full topic

item.title: Thoughts on FreeBSD?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

It’s probably the best server operating system there is. However I’m not sure you’d want to use it as a desktop, especially if you enjoy activities such as gaming.

Read full topic

item.title: Thoughts on FreeBSD?
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:3, topic:547241”][quote author=Justin Bieber link=topic=666143.msg4453416#msg4453416 date=1413138964]
it’s for nerds
[/quote]
nerds r hot ;)[/quote] :eek: :eek:

Read full topic

item.title: Thoughts on FreeBSD?
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:5, topic:547241”][quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=666143.msg4453448#msg4453448 date=1413153309]
Well FreeBSD is a lot like some Linux distros (Gentoo), but BSD in general is kept more self-contained and less “all over the place”. I love how the package system works in FreeBSD. I’d have nothing against using FreeBSD as a primary OS at all.
[/quote]
Yeah? I was thinking about giving it a shot, but I didn’t want to waste time installing it etc., until people actually said good things about it.

What do you mean by it being more self-contained?[/quote]Well I’m pretty sure Linux uses code from plenty of other sources, while BSD tries to keep it more consistent and available in one place all under the same licence. In essence Linux is a lot more diverse than BSD, but at the cost of being more disorganized I guess. BSD also tries to keep more to the core Unix philosophy. I don’t think either is better than the other though.

My explanation definitely isn’t doing it justice and you should probably research it more for yourself. They’re both reasonable options for an OS.

Read full topic

Well FreeBSD is a lot like some Linux distros (Gentoo), but BSD in general is kept more self-contained and less “all over the place”. I love how the package system works in FreeBSD. I’d have nothing against using FreeBSD as a primary OS at all.

Yeah? I was thinking about giving it a shot, but I didn’t want to waste time installing it etc., until people actually said good things about it.

What do you mean by it being more self-contained?
